intro: Caperonia bahiensis f. angustior, commonly known as the narrow-leaved caperonia, is a flowering plant species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent yellow stamens. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
